original_solution_mapping.L1: 1 hour is 60 minutes so 3 hours is 3*60 = <<3*60=180>>180 minutes
original_solution_mapping.L3: He spends 15 minutes on 1 page so he will spend 135 minutes on 135/15 = <<135/15=9>>9 pages

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2829.
    Returns: the total number of pages Rob read.
    """
    # L1
    planned_hours = 3 # three hours reading
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    total_planned_minutes = planned_hours * minutes_per_hour

    # L2
    fraction_numerator = 3 # three-quarters
    fraction_denominator = 4 # three-quarters
    reading_fraction = Fraction(fraction_numerator, fraction_denominator)
    actual_reading_minutes = reading_fraction * total_planned_minutes

    # L3
    minutes_per_page = 15 # reads a page every fifteen minutes
    total_pages_read = actual_reading_minutes / minutes_per_page

    # FA
    answer = total_pages_read
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 1 hour is {minutes_per_hour} minutes so {planned_hours} hours is {planned_hours}*{minutes_per_hour} = <<{planned_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_planned_minutes}>>{total_planned_minutes} minutes

He spends {minutes_per_page} minutes on 1 page so he will spend {actual_reading_minutes} minutes on {actual_reading_minutes}/{minutes_per_page} = <<{actual_reading_minutes}/{minutes_per_page}={total_pages_read}>>{total_pages_read} pages

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 1 hour is 60 minutes so 3 hours is 3*60 = <<3*60=180>>180 minutes
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He spends 15 minutes on 1 page so he will spend 9/4 minutes on 9/4/15 = <<9/4/15=3/20>>3/20 pages

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'fraction_numerator' (value: 3) was used instead of 'total_planned_minutes' (value: 180).
